verses.verse: (Job 5.7; Eccl 2.23) “A mortal, born of woman, few of days and full of trouble,
(Ps 90.5, 6; Jas 1.10; 1 Pet 1.24) comes up like a flower and withers, flees like a shadow and does not last.
(Ps 143.2; 144.3) Do you fix your eyes on such a one? Do you bring me into judgment with you?
(Ps 51.2, 10; Jn 3.6; Rom 5.12; Eph 2.3) Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? No one can.
(Job 21.21; Ps 139.16; Acts 17.26) Since their days are determined, and the number of their months is known to you, and you have appointed the bounds that they cannot pass,
(Job 7.1, 19) look away from them and desist, (Cn: Heb that they may desist) that they may enjoy, like laborers, their days.
“For there is hope for a tree, if it is cut down, that it will sprout again and that its shoots will not cease.
Though its root grows old in the earth and its stump dies in the ground,
(Isa 55.10) yet at the scent of water it will bud and put forth branches like a young plant.
(Job 13.19) But mortals die and are laid low; humans expire, and where are they?
(Isa 19.5) As waters fail from a lake and a river wastes away and dries up,
(Ps 102.26; Acts 3.21; Rev 20.11; 21.1) so mortals lie down and do not rise again; until the heavens are no more, they will not awake or be roused out of their sleep.
(Isa 26.20) O that you would hide me in Sheol, that you would conceal me until your wrath is past, that you would appoint me a set time and remember me!
(Job 7.1) If mortals die, will they live again? All the days of my service I would wait until my release should come.
You would call, and I would answer you; you would long for the work of your hands.
(Job 10.6; 31.4; 34.21; Prov 5.21; Jer 32.19) For then you would not (Syr: Heb lacks not) number my steps; you would not keep watch over my sin;
(Deut 32.34; Hos 13.12) my transgression would be sealed up in a bag, and you would cover over my iniquity.
(Job 18.4) “But the mountain falls and crumbles away, and the rock is removed from its place;
the waters wear away the stones; the torrents wash away the soil of the earth; so you destroy the hope of mortals.
(Job 34.20; Jas 1.10) You prevail forever against them, and they pass away; you change their countenance and send them away.
(Eccl 9.5; Isa 55.10) Their children come to honor, and they do not know it; they are brought low, and it goes unnoticed.
They feel only the pain of their own bodies and mourn only for themselves.”
